title: How to Make Sweet Milk Buns

steps.headline: Activate the yeast.
steps.description: Dissolve the dry yeast in 60 grams of water for 5 minutes to activate it.

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Put the flour, salt, sugar, and milk powder in a large bowl and stir to mix them together.

steps.headline: Beat the egg.
steps.description: Crack one egg into a bowl and whisk it until its yolk and whites are combined.

steps.headline: Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ones.
steps.description: Add the beaten egg and the activated yeast to the bowl of dry ingredients and mix until all ingredients are combined.

steps.headline: Add water.
steps.description: Continue to mix the dough together as you gradually add in the remaining 60 grams of water.

steps.headline: Begin to knead the dough.
steps.description: Place your dough onto a cutting board or smooth surface and start kneading it. Continue kneading until you can stretch out the dough so it's very thin (approximately 1 millimeter thick), and holes form in the stretched dough.

steps.headline: Soften the butter and add it to your dough.
steps.description: Incorporating the butter at this point, rather than at the beginning, makes it easier to knead the dough as the gluten has already formed.

steps.headline: Continue kneading your dough to evenly distribute the butter.
steps.description: Keep kneading until the dough is smooth and flexible, but ensure not to overwork the dough.

steps.headline: Let the dough rest.
steps.description: Put the dough into a large bowl, and cover it either with plastic wrap or with a clean cloth. Leave the dough to rest for approximately 1 hour until it grows to 2-2.5 times its original size.

steps.headline: Divide the dough.
steps.description: Take the dough and shape it into a thick, log-like shape. From there, cut the dough into 4 equal pieces. Take each piece and roll it into a ball with your hands.

steps.headline: Let the dough balls rest.
steps.description: Put each ball onto a baking sheet, cover them again with plastic wrap or a cloth, and let them rest for approximately 15 more minutes.

steps.headline: Make your egg wash.
steps.description: Crack the egg into a small bowl and whisk it together with the 2 tablespoons of water until combined. Brush each dough ball with this egg wash.

steps.headline: Bake the dough.
steps.description: Place the baking sheet into the oven and bake the dough at 165 degrees for approximately 35 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove and let cool.
steps.description: Once the dough has baked, place the baking sheet on a cooling rack.

text: Activate the yeast. Dissolve the dry yeast in 60 grams of water for 5 minutes to activate it. Combine the dry ingredients. Put the flour, salt, sugar, and milk powder in a large bowl and stir to mix them together. Beat the egg. Crack one egg into a bowl and whisk it until its yolk and whites are combined. Combine the wet ingredients with the dry ones. Add the beaten egg and the activated yeast to the bowl of dry ingredients and mix until all ingredients are combined. Add water. Continue to mix the dough together as you gradually add in the remaining 60 grams of water. Begin to knead the dough. Place your dough onto a cutting board or smooth surface and start kneading it. Continue kneading until you can stretch out the dough so it's very thin (approximately 1 millimeter thick), and holes form in the stretched dough. Soften the butter and add it to your dough. Incorporating the butter at this point, rather than at the beginning, makes it easier to knead the dough as the gluten has already formed. Continue kneading your dough to evenly distribute the butter. Keep kneading until the dough is smooth and flexible, but ensure not to overwork the dough. Let the dough rest. Put the dough into a large bowl, and cover it either with plastic wrap or with a clean cloth. Leave the dough to rest for approximately 1 hour until it grows to 2-2.5 times its original size. Divide the dough. Take the dough and shape it into a thick, log-like shape. From there, cut the dough into 4 equal pieces. Take each piece and roll it into a ball with your hands. Let the dough balls rest. Put each ball onto a baking sheet, cover them again with plastic wrap or a cloth, and let them rest for approximately 15 more minutes. Make your egg wash. Crack the egg into a small bowl and whisk it together with the 2 tablespoons of water until combined. Brush each dough ball with this egg wash. Bake the dough. Place the baking sheet into the oven and bake the dough at 165 degrees for approximately 35 minutes. Remove and let cool. Once the dough has baked, place the baking sheet on a cooling rack.
